items.sentence: I think that you should buy yourself a new ladder.
I want to know when my baggage is going to arrive.
I was caught in a shower on my way to the station.
Tom doesn\'t have a ticket for tonight\'s concert.
If it\'s raining tomorrow, we\'ll go there by car.
Tom and Mary need to take a break from each other.
Tom and Mary walked down the street holding hands.
Tom found out that somebody had stolen his wallet.
Tom wasn\'t surprised that Mary didn\'t like John.
Tom doesn\'t believe Mary. He thinks she\'s lying.
Tom doesn\'t deserve the salary we\'re paying him.
Why are you sorry for something you haven\'t done?
Why doesn\'t the U.S. switch to the metric system?
You don\'t know how to operate a forklift, do you?
You wouldn\'t believe the stuff people throw away.
You\'d better not tell anyone about what happened.
What did you think of the movies we saw yesterday?
What do you do when you and Tom hang out together?
What do you think Tom did with the money he stole?
What do you think is the best way to learn French?
